description: Is it safe to travel during an outbreak?
title: Is it safe to travel during an outbreak?
content:
While travelers should always be vigilant with regard to their health and
those around them, the risk of infection for travelers is very low since
person-to-person transmission results from direct contact with the body
fluids. As with any illness or disease, it is always possible that a person
who has been exposed to Ebola virus may choose to travel. If the individual
has not developed symptoms, they cannot transmit Ebola virus to those around
them.

It is however recommended that people minimize non-essential travel to places
that have Ebola. If you have recently been to a place or country that has
confirmed Ebola cases you should be aware of the symptoms of infection and
seek medical attention at the first sign of illness.
